docs.title: Welcome to Bartender
docs.text: Welcome to Bartender. Would you like your tracks shaken, not stirred?

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Clone the Bartender repository: bash git clone <your-repo-url> cd bartender
  2. Install dependencies: pip install -r requirements.txt
  3. Run Bartender and start mixing your tracks!

docs.title: ReccoBeats Utils
docs.text: Utility functions for interacting with the ReccoBeats API. These helpers fetch track info and audio features using a Spotify track ID.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
• Base API URL: https://api.reccobeats.com/v1
  • Requires the requests library.
  • Can be used alongside spotipy_utils for Spotify integration.

docs.title: get_reccobeats_track_data(spotify_id)
docs.text:
Fetches ReccoBeats track info for a given Spotify track ID.

Returns: A dictionary representing the first track in the ReccoBeats content list, or None if not found.

Example fields returned:

  • id – ReccoBeats track ID
  • trackTitle – Track title
  • artists – List of artist objects
  • durationMs – Track duration in milliseconds
  • href – Spotify track link
  • popularity – Track popularity

docs.title: get_reccobeats_track_id(spotify_id)
docs.text: Returns the ReccoBeats track ID for a given Spotify track ID.

docs.title: print_reccobeats_track_id(spotify_id)
docs.text:
Fetches and prints the ReccoBeats track ID.

Example output:

ReccoBeats track id: de5f8816-bde0-4123-9cdd-b0b13d921386

docs.title: print_reccobeats_track_title(spotify_id)
docs.text:
Prints the track title from ReccoBeats for a given Spotify track ID.

Example output:

Track Title: Do I Wanna Know?

docs.title: get_reccobeats_audio_features(track_id)
docs.text:
Fetches audio features for a ReccoBeats track ID.

Returns: A dictionary with keys like:

  • acousticness
  • danceability
  • energy
  • instrumentalness
  • liveness
  • loudness
  • speechiness
  • valence
  • tempo
  • key
  • mode

docs.title: print_reccobeats_audio_features(spotify_id)
docs.text:
Fetches and prints audio features for a Spotify track ID by internally resolving the ReccoBeats ID.

Example output:

ReccoBeats Audio Features
──────────────────────────────
Acousticness : 0.186
Danceability : 0.548
Energy : 0.532
Instrumentalness : 0.000263
Liveness : 0.217
Loudness : -7.596
Speechiness : 0.0323
Valence : 0.405
Tempo : 85.03
Key : 5
Mode : 1
──────────────────────────────

docs.title: Usage Example
docs.text:
from reccobeats_utils import *

spotify_id = "1jEBSDN5vYViJQr78W7jr2"

# Print ReccoBeats track info
print_reccobeats_track_id(spotify_id)
print_reccobeats_track_title(spotify_id)

# Print audio features
print_reccobeats_audio_features(spotify_id)

docs.title: Spotify Utils
docs.text: Utility functions for interacting with the Spotify Web API using the Spotipy library. This module provides tools for playback control, playlist management, searching music, and inspecting currently playing data.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Credentials are loaded automatically from environment variables:

  • SPOTIPY_CLIENT_ID
  • SPOTIPY_CLIENT_SECRET
  • SPOTIPY_REDIRECT_URI

These must be set before using the module.

Every Spotify client is created with the full permission set:

user-read-currently-playing  
user-read-playback-state  
user-modify-playback-state  
user-library-read  
user-top-read  
playlist-read-private  
playlist-modify-private  
playlist-modify-public

docs.title: create_sp()
docs.text:
Creates and returns a fully authenticated spotipy.Spotify client using OAuth.

Used internally by all other functions.

docs.title: Safe Mode (Write Protection)
docs.text: Modifying playlists can be dangerous, so Safe Mode is enabled by default.

docs.title: allow_changes()
docs.text: Disables Safe Mode. Write operations (add/remove/clone playlists) are allowed.

docs.title: disallow_changes()
docs.text: Enables Safe Mode. Write operations are blocked.

docs.title: assert_safe_mode()
docs.text: Returns True if changes are allowed, otherwise prints a warning and blocks the action.

docs.title: search_track(track_name, artist_name=None, limit=1)
docs.text: Searches Spotify for a track.

docs.title: Returns:
docs.text:
A dictionary:

Key Description id Spotify track ID name Track name artists Artist names album Album name release_date Album release year popularity Popularity (0–100) external_url Spotify URL

Returns None if no results.

docs.title: print_track_info(track_info)
docs.text: Pretty-prints the dictionary from search_track().

docs.title: get_current_playing()
docs.text: Returns metadata about the currently playing track, or None.

docs.title: Returned dictionary fields:
docs.text: Key Description id Track ID name Track name artists Artist(s) album Album release_date Album release date popularity Spotify popularity external_url Track link is_playing True/False progress_ms Playback position duration_ms Total duration

docs.title: print_current_playing()
docs.text: Prints a formatted "Now Playing" display with song info and timecodes.

docs.title: get_current_track_id()
docs.text: Returns ID of the currently playing track.

docs.title: print_current_track_id()
docs.text: Prints the current track ID.

docs.title: pause_playback()
docs.text: Pauses the current device.

docs.title: resume_playback()
docs.text: Resumes playback.

docs.title: next_track()
docs.text: Skips to the next track.

docs.title: previous_track()
docs.text: Returns to the previous track.

docs.title: get_current_playlist_id()
docs.text: Returns the playlist ID being listened to, or None if not listening from a playlist.

docs.title: get_current_playlist()
docs.text: Returns the current playlist name, if applicable.

docs.title: print_current_playlist_name()
docs.text: Prints the name of the playlist you're currently listening to.

docs.title: get_current_playlist_info()
docs.text:
Returns metadata for the playlist currently being listened to.

Returned dictionary:

Key Description id Playlist ID name Playlist name owner Owner username url Spotify URL tracks Number of tracks

docs.title: print_current_playlist_info()
docs.text: Pretty-prints playlist metadata.

docs.title: get_playlist_tracks(playlist_id)
docs.text:
Returns all tracks in a playlist, including pagination.

Each track is returned as:

Key Description id Track ID name Track name artists Artist names album Album release_date Release date duration_ms Duration popularity Popularity score url Spotify link

docs.title: print_playlist_tracks_data(playlist_id)
docs.text: Prints all tracks with numbering + formatted duration.

docs.title: print_current_playlist_tracks_data()
docs.text: Prints tracklist for whatever playlist is currently playing.

docs.title: Playlist Modification
docs.text: Note: All operations are blocked unless Safe Mode is disabled using allow_changes().

docs.title: clone_playlist(source_playlist_id, new_name=None, execute=False)
docs.text:
Creates a full duplicate of a playlist.

Parameters:

Parameter Description source_playlist_id Playlist to clone new_name Optional name for new playlist execute If False: Dry-run (no changes)

Returns: new playlist ID or None.

docs.title: add_track_to_playlist(playlist_id, track_id, execute=False)
docs.text: Adds a track to a playlist (requires Safe Mode OFF).

docs.title: remove_track_from_playlist(playlist_id, track_id, execute=False)
docs.text: Removes a specific track from a playlist (requires Safe Mode OFF).

docs.title: print_audio_features(features)
docs.text:
Pretty-prints a dictionary of audio features.

Expected fields:

  • acousticness
  • danceability
  • energy
  • instrumentalness
  • liveness
  • loudness
  • speechiness
  • valence
  • tempo
  • key (optional)
  • mode (optional)
  • time_signature (optional)

If the dict is empty or None, prints a fallback message.
